page.title: 17A GAMEKEEPER'S WORK KNEESALL
page.content: DAVID TODD BAULK LANE,KNEESALL Nr NEWARK NOTTS Three of us went to see David Todd the gamekeeper.We saw some three day old pheasant chicks.He buys day old chicks and rears them.The oldest in the shed were three weeks old.Then he puts them in strengthening off pens at four weeks old.At six to seven weeks old, Mr Todd lets them out into the release pens.After another four weeks they fly out of the release pens into the wild.We also saw a Black East Indian duck with four ducklings.Then Mr Todd took us to the incubator shed.The eggs that are collected from the company's own pheasants are hatched in the incubator.He showed us a bactericide called Nusan, with which he washes the eggs on collection.
